00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the base Unary Operator class
00004 #
00005 package Parser::UOP;
00006 use strict; no strict "refs";
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Item);
00008 
00009 $Parser::class->{UOP} = 'Parser::UOP';
00010 
00011 sub new {
00012   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00013   my $equation = shift; my $context = $equation->{context};
00014   my ($uop,$op,$ref) = @_;
00015   my $def = $context->{operators}{$uop};
00016   my $UOP = bless {
00017     uop => $uop, op => $op,
00018     def => $def, ref => $ref, equation => $equation
00019   }, $def->{class};
00020   $UOP->weaken;
00021   $UOP->{isConstant} = 1 if $op->{isConstant};
00022   $UOP->_check;
00023   $UOP = $UOP->Item("Value")->new($equation,[$UOP->eval])
00024     if $op->{isConstant} && (!$UOP->isNeg || $op->isNeg) &&
00025        ($context->flag('reduceConstants') || $op->{isInfinity});
00026   return $UOP;
00027 }
00028 
00029 #
00030 #  Stub for checking if the BOP can operate on the given operands.
00031 #  (Implemented in subclasses.)
00032 #
00033 sub _check {}

00037 #
00038 #  Evaluate the operand and then perform the operation on it
00039 #
00040 sub eval {
00041   my $self = shift;
00042   $self->_eval($self->{op}->eval);
00043 }
00044 #
00045 #  Stub for sub-classes.
00046 #
00047 sub _eval {return $_[1]}
00048 
00049 
00050 #
00051 #  Reduce the operand.
00052 #  If it is constant and we are not negation (we want to be able to factor it out),
00053 #    return the value of the operation.
00054 #
00055 sub reduce {
00056   my $self = shift; my $uop = $self->{def};
00057   my $equation = $self->{equation};
00058   $self->{op} = $self->{op}->reduce;
00059   return $self->Item("Value")->new($equation,[$self->eval])
00060     if $self->{op}{isConstant} && !$self->isNeg;
00061   $self->_reduce;
00062 }
00063 #
00064 #  Stub for sub-classes.
00065 #
00066 sub _reduce {shift}
00067 
00068 sub substitute {
00069   my $self = shift; my $uop = $self->{def};
00070   my $equation = $self->{equation}; my $context = $equation->{context};
00071   $self->{op} = $self->{op}->substitute;
00072   return $self->Item("Value")->new($equation,[$self->eval])
00073     if $self->{op}{isConstant} && $context->flag('reduceConstants');
00074   return $self;
00075 }
00076 
00077 #
00078 #  Copy the operand as well as the rest of the object
00079 #
00080 sub copy {
00081   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift;
00082   my $new = $self->SUPER::copy($equation);
00083   $new->{op} = $self->{op}->copy($equation);
00084   return $new;
00085 }

00087 ##################################################
00088 #
00089 #  Service routines for checking the types of operands.
00090 #
00091 
00092 
00093 #
00094 #  Error if the operand is a string
00095 #
00096 sub checkString {
00097   my $self = shift; return 0 if $self->context->flag("allowBadOperands");
00098   my $type = $self->{op}->typeRef;
00099   return 0 if ($type->{name} ne 'String');
00100   my $name = $self->{def}{string} || $self->{uop};
00101   $self->Error("Operand of '%s' can't be %s",$name,
00102            ($self->{op}{isInfinite}? 'an infinity': 'a word'));
00103   return 1;
00104 }
00105 
00106 #
00107 #  Error if operand is a list
00108 #
00109 sub checkList {
00110   my $self = shift;  return 0 if $self->context->flag("allowBadOperands");
00111   my $type = $self->{op}->typeRef;
00112   return 0 if ($type->{name} ne 'List');
00113   my $name = $self->{def}{string} || $self->{uop};
00114   $self->Error("Operand of '%s' can't be a list",$name);
00115   return 1;
00116 }
00117 
00118 
00119 #
00120 #  Determine if the operand is an infinity and set the type
00121 #
00122 sub checkInfinite {
00123   my $self = shift;
00124   my $uop = $self->{def};
00125   return 0 unless $self->{op}->{isInfinite} && $uop->{allowInfinite};
00126   $self->{type} = $self->{op}->typeRef;
00127   return 1;
00128 }
00129 
00130 #
00131 #  Determine if the operand is a number, and set the type
00132 #    to complex or number according to the type of operand.
00133 #
00134 sub checkNumber {
00135   my $self = shift;
00136   return 0 if !($self->{op}->isNumber);
00137   if ($self->{op}->isComplex) {$self->{type} = $Value::Type{complex}}
00138   else {$self->{type} = $Value::Type{number}}
00139   return 1;
00140 }

00144 #  Service routines for adjusting the values of operands.

00146 
00147 #
00148 #  Produce a reduced negation of an item.
00149 #
00150 sub Neg {
00151   my $self = shift;
00152   my $equation = $self->{equation};
00153   $self->Error("Can't reduce:  negation operator is not defined")
00154     if (!defined($equation->{context}{operators}{'u-'}));
00155   return ($self->Item("UOP")->new($equation,'u-',$self))->reduce;
00156 }
00157 
00158 #
00159 #  Get the variables used in the operand
00160 #
00161 sub getVariables {
00162   my $self = shift;
00163   $self->{op}->getVariables;
00164 }
00165 
00166 ##################################################
00167 #
00168 #  Generate the various output formats.
00169 #
00170 
00171 
00172 #
00173 #  Produce a string version of the equation.
00174 #
00175 #  We add parentheses if the precedence of the operator is less
00176 #    than the parent operation.
00177 #  Add the operator before or after the operand according to the
00178 #    associativity of the operator.
00179 #
00180 sub string {
00181   my ($self,$precedence,$showparens,$position,$outerRight) = @_;
00182   my $string; my $uop = $self->{def}; $position = '' unless defined($position);
00183   my $extraParens = $self->context->flag('showExtraParens');
00184   my $addparens = ((defined($precedence) && $precedence >= $uop->{precedence}) ||
00185                     $position eq 'right' || $outerRight) && $extraParens;
00186   if ($uop->{associativity} eq "right") {
00187     $string = $self->{op}->string($uop->{precedence}).$uop->{string};
00188   } else {
00189     $string = $uop->{string}.$self->{op}->string($uop->{precedence});
00190   }
00191   $string = $self->addParens($string) if $addparens;
00192   return $string;
00193 }
00194 
00195 #
00196 #  Produce the TeX form
00197 #
00198 sub TeX {
00199   my ($self,$precedence,$showparens,$position,$outerRight) = @_;
00200   my $TeX; my $uop = $self->{def}; $position = '' unless defined($position);
00201   my $fracparens = ($uop->{nofractionparens}) ? "nofractions" : "";
00202   my $extraParens = $self->context->flag('showExtraParens');
00203   my $addparens = ((defined($precedence) && $precedence >= $uop->{precedence}) ||
00204                     $position eq 'right' || $outerRight) && $extraParens;
00205   $TeX = (defined($uop->{TeX}) ? $uop->{TeX} : $uop->{string});
00206   if ($uop->{associativity} eq "right") {
00207     $TeX = $self->{op}->TeX($uop->{precedence},$fracparens) . $TeX;
00208   } else {
00209     $TeX = $TeX . $self->{op}->TeX($uop->{precedence},$fracparens);
00210   }
00211   $TeX = '\left('.$TeX.'\right)' if $addparens;
00212   return $TeX;
00213 }
00214 
00215 #
00216 #  Produce a Perl expression
00217 #
00218 sub perl {
00219   my $self = shift; my $parens = shift;
00220   my $uop = $self->{def}; my $perl;
00221   if ($uop->{isCommand}) {
00222     $perl = ($uop->{perl} || ref($self).'->call').'('.$self->{op}->perl.')';
00223   } else {
00224     $perl = ($uop->{perl} || $uop->{string})." ".$self->{op}->perl(1);
00225   }
00226   $perl = '('.$perl.')' if $parens;
00227   return $perl;
00228 }
